title.narrative: FLC/CEDEP Improving access to justice and security among the sexual minorities in Malawi

description.narrative: Institutionalised homophobia criminalisation of homosexuality under the Malawi Penal Code and widespread social stigma strip Malawian LGBTI persons of their legal economic health and sexual rights. Through this project CEDEP aims to contribute to safeguard ing of human rights and improved access to both formal and informal justice and security for sexual minorities in Malawi. The project will train 100 LGBTI peer educators to reach out to 3000 LGBTI members about their rights and different legal redress and protection services available. Various legal and security institutions will also be trained on their human rights obligations in relation to the LGBTI community members to ensure impartial investigations and prosecution processes. The access to justice of LGBTI will be further enhanced through a legal desk helpline and pro bono lawyers. The Malawian government has given a statement in 2012 on not to arrest individuals on the basis of real or perceived sexual orientation and CEDEP will also use this as an ad vocacy opportunity to try to address the current discriminatory laws. The project anticipates a reduction of arrests of the LGBTI members by the police and improved access to justice services by sexual minorities in Malawi.
